q: What is the maximum speed limit in Flanders on a ordinary road? (... km/h)
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree The public road

q: What is the maximum speed limit on an ordinary road in Wallonia? (... km/h)
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree The public road

optionb: Your driving licence will be suspended for a certain period.
optionc: You have to do a theoretical and practical examination again.
q: You drive 105kph on a regular road with a maximum speed limit of 90kph. What are the consequences?
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree The public road

q: What is the maximum speed limit in Flanders on a regular road? (... kph)
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree The lanes

q: Is the driver of the blue car allowed to turn left to enter the driveway of his home?
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree The lanes

q: Is the driver of the red car allowed to overtake the green car on the left.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree on our page The lanes

q: Is car A allowed to turn left?
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree The lanes

optionc: Yes, but not more than 50% of the cycle lane.
q: Is the blue car allowed to use the cycle lane a bit in order to overtake the car, that wants to turn left, on the right?
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree The bicycle lane

q: The ambulance with your father on board , drives 140 km/hour. Are you allowed to follow the ambulance?
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree The motorway

q: The driver of this car is allowed on that place in Flanders to drive maximum (_________) kph.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree The motorway

q: On this express road in Flanders the driver of the orange car is allowed to drive maximum (_________) km/hour.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree The express road

q: On this express road in Flanders the driver of the blue car is allowed to drive maximum (_________) kph.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree The express road

q: On this express road in Wallonia with 2x2 lanes, a car is allowed to drive maximum (_________) kph.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree The express road

q: On this express road in Flanders with 2x2 lanes you are allowed to drive maximum (_________) kph with a car.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree The express road

q: What is the maximum speed limit (_________ km/hour) a car is allowed to drive on this express road within a built up area in Wallonia?
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree The express road

optiona: This is an offence and you will be fined.
optionb: This is an offence and your driving licence can be suspended immediately.
q: You want to test your car and you drive 167kph on this express road.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree The express road

optionc: Only during the school hours and not on holidays.
q: When does the speed limit apply?
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Special places

q: In a residential area or estate you are allowed to drive maximum (_________) km/hour.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Special places

q: In Flanders, you are allowed to drive maximum (_________) kph with your car past these sign.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree The places

optiona: ... children are allowed to play on the road.
optionb: ... you are allowed to drive maximum 25kph with a car.
optionc: ... you are only allowed to park on reserved places.
q:
What is WRONG?
In a residential area or estate _________

A. ... children are allowed to play on the road.
B. ... you are allowed to drive maximum 25kph with a car.
C. ... you are only allowed to park on reserved places.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Special places

q:
You have a driving licence B.
When you drive more than (_________) kph too fast, the judge will disqualify you from driving.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Special places

q: What is the maximum speed limit of a car in a play street?
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Special places

q:
A pedestrian is not using or going to use the pedestrian crossing.
Is the red car allowed to overtake the blue one on the left?
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree The pedestrians

q:
The pedestrian is not yet on the crossing.
Does the driver have to stop?
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree The pedestrians

q: Children until the age of (_________), smaller than 1.35m, must be seated in an appropriate safety seat  for children.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree The load and the passenger spaces

q:
Children younger than 18 and smaller than (_________)m must be seated in an appropriate safety seat for children.

A. 1m35cm.
B. 1m45cm.
C. 1m55cm.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree The load and the passenger spaces

q:
Which sign indicates that drivers of vehicles transporting inflammable goods are not allowed to drive past this sign?

A. Sign 1.
B. Sign 2.
C. Sign 3.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree The load and the passenger spaces

q:
The fuel of your car is LPG or petrol.
Are you allowed to drive past this sign with your car?

A. Yes.
B. No.
C. Yes, only when you switch from LPG to petrol.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree The load and the passenger spaces

q: The dipped beam headlights must be switched on from sunset until dawn or during the day when you can’t see (_________) m ahead due to rain, fog, snow or other circumstances.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree The lights

q: You must switch off the headlights or driving lamps when the driver in front of you is less than (_________)m away.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree The lights

q: The dipped beam headlights or low beam must be used during the day when it’s snowing and the visibility is less than (_________)m.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree The lights

q: During heavy rainfall the dipped beam headlights must be used during the day when the visibility is less than (_________) meters.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree The lights

q:
Which lights must be switched on when you drive in a tunnel and you can’t see 200 meters ahead?

A. Lights are not obligatory.
B. The fog lights.
C. The dipped beam headlights.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree The lights

q: On a speed hump you are allowed to drive maximum (_________) kph.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree

q:
This speed limit only applies _________

A. ... to vehicles with a trailer.
B. ... on the exit.
C. ... when inserting to the motorway.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree

q: Past these signs in Flanders, you are allowed to drive maximum (_________) kph with a car.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree

q: The  blue car on this express road in Flanders is allowed to drive maximum (_________) kph.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree

q: You are allowed to drive maximum (_________) kph with a car on this road in Flanders.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree

q: What is the maximum speed limit (_________ kph) for these cars at that location in Flanders?
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree

q: What is the maximum speed limit (_________ kph) for these cars on this express road within a built up area in Wallonia?
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree

q: What is the maximum speed for a car in this street?
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree

q: What is the maximum speed limit (_________ kph) for a car at this junction?
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree

q:
How many kph are you driving too fast on this road within a built up area in order for the police to take away your driving licence immediately for a certain period of time?

A. From more than 20 kph too fast.
B. From more than 30 kph too fast.
C. From mote than 40 kph too fast.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree

q:
You drive too fast in a zone 30.
How many kph too fast is needed for the POLICE to withhold your driving licence immediately.

A. More than 20 kph to fast.
B. More than 30 kph too fast.
C. More than 40 kph too fast.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree

q:
What is the maximum speed limit you can drive in a cycle street?

A. 20 kph.
B. 30 kph.
C. Walking pace.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree

q:
Is the driver of the blue car allowed to drive on the reserved cycle lane in order to ease the passing?

A. Yes, he is.
B. He isn’t only allowed to, he must do it.
C. No, he isn’t.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree The Crossing

q: Is a driver allowed to drive on the levelled verge to ease the passing?
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree The Crossing

q: Are you allowed to overtake a tram on the left when you come across an obstacle on the road?
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree The Crossing

q:
What do these cars have to do at this junction?

A. They pas each other on the right.
B. They pas each other on the left.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree The Crossing

A suggested/reserved cycle lane.
When passing a car _________

A. ... you are not allowed to drive on it.
B. ... you are allowed to drive on it.
C. ... you must drive on it.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree The Crossing

A. Picture 1.

q:
Who has priority?

A. Car A.
B. Car B.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree The Crossing

e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Overtakinng

q:
There are no cyclists on and near the crossing.

e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Overtakinng

The blue car is slowing down.

B. Yes.

B. ... 1,5 meter.
C. ... 2 meters.

q:

A. ... 1 meter.

q:
If you want to overtake this cyclist on the left outside a built up area, you have to leave a safe space in between of _________

B. ... 1,5 meter.

e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Overtakinng

q:
Two arms stretched out horizontally have the same meaning as one arm.

A. Correct.
B. Incorrect.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Qualified persons

q:
A police car with blue flashing lights and warning signal.
What do you do?

A. You give priority.
B. You drive faster in order to stay ahead.
C. You just drive on as if nothing is happening.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Qualified persons

q: Is the blue car allowed to cross over the junction?
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Qualified persons

q:
Who is allowed to cross the junction?

A. The blue car.
B. The brown car.
C. Not the blue car nor the brown one.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Qualified persons

q: Is the red car allowed to cross the junction?
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Qualified persons

q:
Who is allowed to cross the junction?

A. The green car.
B. The blue car.
C. The moped.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Qualified persons

q:
The driver of the black car wants to turn left.

A. He is allowed.
B. He is only allowed to drive on.
C. He must stop.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Qualified persons

q:
Who is allowed to cross the junction?

A. The blue and the green car.
B. The brown car and the moped.
C. No one.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Qualified persons

q:
Who must stop?

A. The blue car.
B. Everyone.
C. The red car and the moped.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Qualified persons

q: Is the blue car still allowed to turn left?
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Qualified persons

q:
Who is allowed to cross the junction?

A. No one.
B. The moped.
C. The brown car.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Qualified persons

q:
Which order does the police officer give?

A. The driver must stop next to the road.
B. The driver must turn left.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Qualified persons

q:
The driver of this car must stop.

A. Correct.
B. Incorrect.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Qualified persons

q:
The driver of the moped _________

A. ... is allowed to drive straight through.
B. ... must turn left.
C. ... must stop.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Qualified persons

q:
You approach this police officer with your car.

A. You are allowed to cross the junction.
B. You must stop.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Qualified persons

q:
You approach this junction.
Do you have to stop?
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Qualified persons

q:
The traffic lights are out of order.
Who is allowed to cross first?

A. The moped.
B. The red car.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Qualified persons

q:
The traffic lights turn amber.
The blue car _________

A. ... must always stop.
B. ... is allowed to drive past the amber lights if it can’t stop safely anymore.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Traffic lights

q:
A yellow arrow above a lane means _________

A. ... you must leave the lane.
B. ... you must take the first exit.
C. ... the first exit is closed.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Traffic lights

q:
The driver of the brown car wants to cross at the junction.
Does he have to consider the red light?
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Traffic lights

q:
The barriers are going down.
You are only allowed to pass the red flashing lights and the lowering barriers when you can’t stop safely anymore.

A. Correct.
B. You are under no circumstances allowed to pass.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Traffic lights

q:
You want to turn right.
Do you have to stop first, before you cross the junction?
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Traffic lights

q: Does the driver of the blue car have to give right of way to the pedestrian?
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Traffic lights

q:
The green filter arrow is lit up.
Is the driver of the blue car still allowed to cross at the junction and turn left?
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Traffic lights

q:
The arrow you see here is a green filter arrow which indicates that the drivers who are already on the junction can drive safely to the left.

A. Correct.
B. False.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Traffic lights

q:
You see these lights.
What can you do?

A. Just turn right.
B. Straight ahead or turn right.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Traffic lights

q:
Who is allowed to cross first at the junction?

A. The blue car.
B. The brown car.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Traffic lights

q:
Who has priority?

A. Car A.
B. Car B.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Priority and changing directions

q:
You hear the warning bell sound, but the barriers are still completely open.

A. You are allowed to drive through.
B. You must stop.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree

q: Are you allowed to come out of this street with a car?
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree

q: Is the blue car allowed to turn right?
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Prohibited directions

q:
What does this sign indicate?

A. The M.G.W.
B. The M.A.W.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Prohibited directions

q: Are you allowed to drive past this sign with a car?
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Prohibited directions

q: Are all passenger cars allowed to drive past this sign?
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Prohibited directions

q:
This sign indicates _________

A. ... the M.A.W. (Maximum Authorized Weight).
B. ... the M.G.W. (Maximum Gross Weight).
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Prohibited directions

q: Is a car allowed to drive past this sign?
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Prohibited directions

q: Can you send a text while waiting in the car for a red light?
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Traffic lights

q:
What is correct?
In a residential area ...

A. ... is the maximum speed limit 25 km/hour.
B. ... are cars allowed to park on the left and right of the direction of travel.
C. ... may pedestrians and cyclists use the full lane.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Special places

q:
A school bus has stopped and the hazard warning lights are being used. What do you have to do?

A. Stop.
B. Slow down and stop if necessary.
C. Drive on.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree The Lights

q:
In this street, two cars want to cross each other.
How much lateral distance must be kept?

A. Sufficient.
B. 1,5 meters.
C. 1 meter.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree The Crossing

q:
The blue car driver approaches the back of the agent.

A. He must stop.
B. He may turn to the right.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Qualified persons

q:
What is the hierarchical order?

A. 1 - 2 - 3.
B. 3 - 2 - 1.
C. 3 - 1 - 2.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Qualified persons

q:
A crossroad without traffic signs.
In what situation the pedestrian has priority?

A. Only drawing A.
B. Only drawing B.
C. Drawing A + B.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Priority and changing directions

q:
An intersection with traffic signs.
In what situation the pedestrian has priority?

A. Only drawing A.
B. Only drawing B.
C. Drawing A + B.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Priority and changing directions

q:
Your girlfriend lives in this pedestrian zone.
Can you drive your car to her home?
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree The Pedestrians

q:
The barriers are still fully open, but the alarm signal is clearly audible.
Can you still drive on the road?
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Traffic lights

q:
The traffic light turns orange.
Can you still cross the intersection?

A. Yes.
B. Yes, if you endanger others by stopping.
C. No.
e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree Traffic lights

q: Is it allowed to overtake a moped on the left beyond this sign?
e: [Violations of the 3th and 4th degree] The red sign says that drivers are forbidden to overtake a vehicle with more than two wheels on the left.

q:
What is right?
Beyond this sign....

A..... a car may overtake a motorcycle on the left.
B..... a motorcycle may overtake a car on the left.
C..... a car or motorcycle may not overtake on the left.
e: [Violations of the 3th and 4th degree] The red sign says that drivers are forbidden to overtake a vehicle with more than two wheels on the left.

q:
The police will stop you, because you drive 75 km/h in a built-up area.
What are the consequences?

A. You must pay a fine to the police.
B. Your driving licence can be withdrawn immediately and temporarily.
C. You must appear before the police judge within 14 days.

e.q:
Can you overtake a moped on the left at this level crossing?

A. No, overtaking on the left is forbidden,
B. No, only a cyclist.
C. Yes.
e.e: Violations of the 3th and 4th degree - Train, tram, bus
